publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Oswego

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created with EADitor by Kathryn Johns-Masten
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: The family papers consist primarily of surveying notes generated by, or collected by, various members of the Babcock and Foster families of Oswego County, New York. The bulk of material can be attributed to A.H. Foster, who surveyed Williamstown and Amboy between [1930 and 1870]. The collection also includes field notes, maps, deeds, and mortgages from various surveyors and residents of Oswego County.

repository.corpname: State University of New York at Oswego

accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to the public.

bioghist.p: A.H. Foster reportedly immigrated to Williamstown, New York from Schaghticoke, New York in 1830. He was employed as a surveyor within Oswego County and surveyed lands in the townships of Williamstown and Amboy. His daughter Charlotte E. Foster married Ogden E. Babcock, who was also a local surveyor. A.H. Foster died in 1870 and his estate passed on to his daughter and the Babcock family.

scopecontent.p: The family papers consist primarily of surveying notes generated by, or collected by, various members of the Babcock and Foster families of Oswego County, New York. The bulk of material can be attributed to A.H. Foster, who surveyed Williamstown and Amboy between [1930 and 1870]. The collection also includes field notes, maps, deeds, and mortgages from various surveyors and residents of Oswego County.

userestrict.p: Please contact SUNY Oswego Archives and Special Collections for use restrictions.

scopecontent.p: Five surveyor’s notebooks prepared by Elijah Blake, William Rowell, and A.H. Foster. The area covered by their work represented here is generally the towns of Williamstown and Amboy, Oswego County, N.Y.

did.unittitle: Rowell, William [?] Plot book of township 13 [Hastings]

scopecontent.p: Notebook indicated lots by number, their dimensions, total acres enclosed. Some note of owner and purchase price of lots is given. Scale: 10 chains = 1 inch

did.unittitle: Foster, A.H. Plot book of township 6 [Amboy]

scopecontent.p: No scale is given. Indicates lots of number, their dimensions in chains, total acreage enclosed. Notebook also includes a copy of Elijah Blake’s survey of the Old Mexico Road. Copy dated April 1, 1851, Utica, N.Y.

did.unittitle: Rowell, William [?] Plot book of Osceola, N.Y.

scopecontent.p: No scale given. Indicates lots of number, their dimensions, total acreage enclosed.

did.unittitle: Unknown. A.H. Foster’s name written in back of book

scopecontent.p: Charles [?] H. Cross’name written in front of book. Field notebook relating to survey activities in township 3, dated August 18, 1795 through June 7, 1797. Notes indicate direction and distances, as well as description of terrain and woodlands through which the survey ran.

did.unittitle: Blake, Elijah. “A Survey of Town No. 5, Scriba Patent [Williamstown] surveyed into spots.

scopecontent.p: A.D.1799 by E[lijah] Blake under Benj[amin] Wright”, copied by A.H. Foster. Date of copy unknown

Road survey notes prepared by A.H. Foster for roads in the towns of Amboy, Mexico, Parish, and Williamstown, as well as the village of Camden and Florence in the period 1832-1872. The notes appear on separate slips of paper and typically indicate only compass directions and distances as measured in chains. Included in these notes are several copies of road surveys made in the area of Elijah Blake made in the ca. 1790-1801 period.
Bills, receipts, etc. Includes a typescript copy of a re-survey of the streets of the village of Camden, N.Y., in 1893 by P.W. Leete.
Deeds, mortgages, and bonds, ca. 1880-1930. Individuals represented include Ezra and David, and Seymour Spoon, and Mary Rayder, all of the Amboy area.
